subject: Real Estate
title: The Skyscraper Revolution
description: A fast breakdown of The Skyscraper Revolution for builders.

hook.text: In 1885, Chicago's Home Insurance Building rose ten stories â€” the world's first steel-frame skyscraper.

buildup.text: Steel frames meant walls no longer held the building up. You could go as high as the elevator allowed.

discovery.text: Skyscrapers multiplied land value vertically. One acre could now hold the floor space of twenty.

twist.text: Manhattan's bedrock geology determined which neighborhoods went tall and which stayed low.

climax.text: The skyscraper turned real estate from a land game into a volume game almost overnight.

punchline.text: Steel and elevators made land grow upward.

quiz.question: Why did skyscrapers multiply land value?
options: They stacked usable floor space vertically
